intro: Schubertia hatschbachii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it conserve water in dry environments. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to access deep groundwater sources. Schubertia hatschbachii is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
